Job Title: Growth Manager

Location: San Francisco, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
As a part of Asana’s mission to enable the world’s teams to work together effortlessly, the Global Growth team is deeply committed to helping self-serve teams and businesses discover Asana, helping them get started, discover value from our paying tiers, and stay with Asana over the long term. We combine pure self-serve or traditional PLG with innovative new customer assist motions, aiming to build the best and most efficient global customer acquisition, onboarding, expansion, and retention experiences.

We are seeking a passionate, data-driven Growth Manager for our Self-Serve business on Global Growth. As a Growth Manager, you will develop strategies and lead initiatives that maximize revenue impact by working in partnership with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Sales, Product, Customer Experience, Data Science and Analytics) on the highest impact opportunities to drive better conversion, expansion or retention of Asana’s customers. You will excel in strategic thinking, analytical rigor, stakeholder management and an understanding of the SaaS customer journey, pain-points and motivations. The ideal candidate will bring curiosity, a willingness to experiment, openness to risk, and a test-and-learn mindset. This role will directly report to the Head of Self Serve business.

This role is based in our San Francisco office with an office-centric hybrid schedule. The standard in-office days are Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday. Most Asanas have the option to work from home on Wednesdays. Working from home on Fridays depends on the type of work you do and the teams with which you partner. If you're interviewing for this role, your recruiter will share more about the in-office requirements.

What You’ll Achieve

Develop data-driven growth strategies and experiments to drive revenue growth by improving conversion, adoption and retention across the customer lifecycleDemonstrate strong data analysis skills to identify growth opportunities across customer lifecycle, refine strategies based on insights, analyze performance and share recommendationsInfluence cross-functional partners (product, engineering, marketing, design, data science, analytics) to ensure alignment and resourcing for revenue growth initiativesBe accountable for key performance metrics related to the impact and reach of initiativesDevelop presentations to showcase progress for initiatives, results, and recommendations as part of MBRs and QBRs to partners and the leadership team

About You

Bachelor's degree or higher, quantitative field of study strongly preferred5+ years of experience in management consulting, revenue growth, product, or business operations role in tech or SaaSExperience developing and operationalizing strategic plans, including developing business case, navigating partner team priorities, and ensuring timely executionExceptional data and analytical skills with proficiency in SQL and experience using analytic platforms and growth tools. Familiar with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, Tableau, GrowthBook)Excellent communication and presentation skills, including ability to simplify complex ideas and systems Proven ability to influence and work cross-functionally with executive stakeholders, acting as a trusted advisor within challenging and complex situationsStrong teamwork and project management skills, experience leading cross-functional, multi-stakeholder initiatives, with a track record of delivering resultsWillingness to roll up your sleeves and find creative solutions to ambiguous challenges

At Asana, we're committed to building teams that include a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, as this is critical to helping us achieve our mission. If you're interested in this role and don't meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

What We’ll Offer

Our comprehensive compensation package plays a big part in how we recognize you for the impact you have on our path to achieving our mission. We believe that compensation should be reflective of the value you create relative to the market value of your role. To ensure pay is fair and not impacted by biases, we're committed to looking at market value which is why we check ourselves and conduct a yearly pay equity audit.

For this role, the estimated base salary range is between $185,000 - $235,000. The actual base salary will vary based on various factors, including market and individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process. The listed range above is a guideline, and the base salary range for this role may be modified.

In addition to base salary, your compensation package may include additional components such as equity, sales incentive pay (for most sales roles), and benefits. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.

We strive to provide equitable and competitive benefits packages that support our employees worldwide and include:

Mental health, wellness & fitness benefitsCareer coaching & supportInclusive family building benefitsLong-term savings or retirement plansIn-office culinary options to cater to your dietary preferences 

These are just some of the benefits we offer, and benefits may vary based on role, country, and local regulations. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.

About Us

Asana helps teams orchestrate their work, from small projects to strategic initiatives. Millions of teams around the world rely on Asana to achieve their most important goals, faster. Asana has been named a Top 10 Best Workplace for 5 years in a row, is Fortune's #1 Best Workplace in the Bay Area, and one of Glassdoor’s and Inc.’s Best Places to Work. After spending more than a year physically distanced, Team Asana is safely and mindfully returning to in-person collaboration, incorporating flexibility that adds hybrid elements to our office-centric culture . With 11+ offices all over the world, we are always looking for individuals who care about building technology that drives positive change in the world and a culture where everyone feels that they belong.

We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also comply with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws in other locations.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
